short_instructions.https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s: For this puzzle, drag all of the blocks together and click "Run" to watch it go!
Drag an extra `move forward` block out of the toolbox to finish your code.
There is one extra block that is going to cause the bird to crash. Throw it away by dragging it back to the toolbox.
Avoid TNT or feathers will fly!
Avoid the TNT.
"Keep calm and help me find the bad pig. Otherwise I might get angry!"
**Challenge:** This code has a lot of bugs. You'll need to remove some blocks and add others.
_"Keep calm and help me find the bad pig."_
_"Keep calm and help me find the bad pig."_
_"Now, help me sneak up on the pig any way you want to!"_
The pig is hiding, and the goal is to find it.
Sometimes there is more than one way to solve the same problem. Sometimes it's faster to go backwards than it is to go forwards!
Fix the code to help get Scrat get to the acorn.
Use your debugging skills to get Scrat to the acorn.
Remove blocks to get Scrat to the acorn!
Someone has their directions mixed up! Can you help?
Debug this level by rearranging and changing blocks.
Figure out what is wrong and get Scrat to the acorn.
**Challenge:** Debug this level by rearranging, adding, and deleting blocks.
Debug this level to get Scrat to the acorn.
Help Scrat decide which way to turn to get to the acorn.
Help Scrat reach the acorn with only four `turn` commands.
Play around with the blocks to see if you can help Laurel collect some treasure.
Move Laurel to the treasure, then use `collect` to pick it up.
Order these blocks to collect the treasure and solve the puzzle.
Put these blocks in order to collect all of the treasure and solve the puzzle.
These blocks are in the wrong order. Can you fix them?
Reorder the blocks to collect all of the treasure.
Use blocks from the toolbox to collect all of the treasure.
_"Keep up the good work! Help me collect all of the treasure."_
_"Let's get all of the treasure!"_
Help Laurel collect all of the treasure.
You're almost done! Collect as many pieces of treasure as you can to finish the stage!
Look carefully! Can you collect all **10** pieces of treasure?
Collect at least **10** pieces of treasure to finish this challenge!
Play with the blocks in the toolbox to see what they do!
Drag blocks onto the screen to have the artist draw over the grey lines in the picture. (Each line is 100 pixels long)
Each side of the inner square is 100 pixels and all of the angles are 90 degrees.
Finish Starla's rocket so she can chase her pet.

Finish this tag by drawing a rectangle around the outside.
(The long sides are 200 pixels each and the short sides are each 100 pixels)
Draw this diamond with 200 pixel sides.
**Challenge:** This tag is a special one!  Can you figure out how to draw the outline?

One more tag.  This is a triangle for Pi.
(Each side is 150 pixels)
Draw rooms for each of the animals.
_"Help me paint the yellow lines on this road!"_
BB-8 will pick up any metal scraps along the path where he moves. Use 5 of the same block to get BB-8 to pick up all of the scrap metal in the play area.
BB-8 will pick up any metal scraps along the path where he moves. Use 5 of the same block to get BB-8 to pick up all of the scrap metal in the play area.
To get all the scrap metal, try creating a loop that uses only one block inside of a `repeat` block.
In this puzzle, two `repeat` loops will help you get BB-8 to all of the scrap metal with the fewest number of blocks!
Get BB-8 to pick up all the scrap metal as quickly as possible!
Loops even work with more than one block inside!  Can you loop this sequence?
Can you try to get all the scrap metal using just one loop? Try programming it all out then finding the repeating code to put in a loop.
Use what you have learned to pick up all of the scrap metal!
You are doing great! Keep it up!
You are doing great! Keep it up!
You are almost there! This time, choose any path you like!
Now Scrat wants to try using loops to find his acorn!
Get at least **5** pieces of treasure!
Get the artist to the center of the play area, then draw a line.
Time to spin that line around!
Let's add some pizazz with a `set pattern` block.
Get the artist to the center of the play area, then draw a bird using a sticker.
Now, use a loop to spin your bird around 12 times with a 30 degree turn.
Now add a bat!
Try jumping forward by 75 pixels.
Try new stickers!
Try adding lines!
Add another sticker!
Play with the loops and angles.
Now try something on your own!
Use loops to pick all of the pumpkins.
Can you combine two different loops to move toward the pumpkins, then collect them all?
Collect all of the pumpkins.
Collect all of the corn and all of the pumpkins.
Collect all of the corn and all of the pumpkins.
Collect all of the corn and all of the pumpkins.
Collect all of the corn and all of the pumpkins.
**Challenge:** Collect all of the corn and all of the pumpkins.
Collect all of the corn and all of the pumpkins.
Collect all of the corn and all of the pumpkins.
Collect all of the corn and all of the pumpkins.
Collect all of the corn.
Collect all of the lettuce. Avoid the trees and fields!
Attach the `flap normal amount` block to the `when click` event, then press "Run".    Click or tap on the play space to move Flappy to the target.
Try adding a block that sets the level speed when the "Run" button is pressed.  Play the game and flap to the target to continue.
Attach the `end game` block to the `when hit the ground` event.   Play the game and crash the bird into the ground to continue.
Attach a block to the `when hit an obstacle` event so that the game ends when Flappy crashes into the first set of pipes.
Add a block to the `when pass an obstacle` event, then press "Run" to score a point by flying Flappy through the first set of pipes.
See if you can still score a point after making Flappy flap either a smaller or larger amount each time you click.
Next, try changing the scene by attaching a block to the `when run` event.
Try setting a **random** scene when other events happen...for example, when passing an obstacle.
To mix things up, instead of ending the game when Flappy hits an obstacle, try setting the score back to 0.
Create your own Flappy game!
Make Jorge the Dog (actor 1) say "Hi there."
Can you make Jorge the Dog (actor 1) say something, then have Olive the Cat (actor 2) say something afterward?
Can you write a program to make Jorge (actor 1) move toward Olive the Cat?
Can you write a program that makes Jorge (actor 1) move to Olive the Cat, and have Olive say "Hi there." when Jorge reaches her?
Can you write a program to make Octavia the Octopus say "What's new?" when she is clicked?
Now, write a program to make Waddles the Penguin move around using the up / down / left / right keys to hit all of the targets!
The `repeat forever` block allows you to run code over and over forever.  Use this block to move Chomp the Dino (actor 2) up and down by 400 pixels forever.

Can you have Waddles (actor 1) play a "hit" sound and say "Ouch!" if he runs into Chomp? 
When you're done, play the game to make that happen.

Can you add a block to score a point when Waddles the Penguin (actor1) runs into Octavia the Octopus (actor 3)? 
Play the game and move Waddles with the arrows until you score!

Add blocks to the `when run` event to change the background scene and the speed of Waddles the Penguin.

Play the game and move Waddles with the arrows until you score.
Create your own story. When you're done, click "Finish" to share with friends. See story ideas in the hints.

Use a new block to make Waddles automatically move back to the start when he runs into the Dinosaur and when he scores a point. 
Play the game and move Waddles with the arrows until you score enough points.
Add a second `move forward` block to reach the sheep.
Wood is a very important resource. Many things are made from it. Walk to the tree and use the “destroy block” command to chop it down.
Sheep-shearing time! Use the “shear” command to gather wool from both sheep.
We need to build a house before the sun goes down. Houses require a lot of wood. Cut down all 3 trees.
Every house starts with a wall. Build the first part of your house by putting the "place" and "move forward" commands inside the repeat loop.
Build the rest of your house from any material you'd like. The "repeat" command will come in handy.
It’s good to plan ahead. Plant crops on both sides of the water so you don’t get hungry later on.
Running into a Creeper is a bad idea. Carefully move past the Creepers and reach the safety of your home.
You’ll find the most valuable resources underground, but it can get dark. Place at least 2 torches and mine at least 2 coal.
Walking into molten lava is a bad idea. Place cobblestone to create a bridge, then mine at least two of the iron blocks.

Lava is hiding beneath some of these blocks, which you'll need to cover up before moving forward. An "if" command will come in handy here. Add a "move forward" command in the correct place to mine these blocks.
Now things are getting tricky. Mine 3 redstone, but don’t fall in the lava. Use an "If" command to place cobblestone over any lava you uncover.
Great job! You’ve gathered lots of resources and built a modest home. Now lay rail from the edge of the map to the door of your house.
Congratulations! You've completed all our puzzles! Now mine, build, and create something unique by using everything you've learned so far.

long_instructions.https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s: For this puzzle, drag all of the blocks together and click "Run" to watch it go!
Drag an extra <xml><block type="maze_moveForward"/></xml> block out of the toolbox to finish your code.

_"This pig is ruffling my feathers."_

There is one extra block that is going to cause the bird to crash.  
Throw it away by unhooking it from the grey blocks and dragging it back to the toolbox.

_"Trace the path and lead me to the silly pig."_ 

Avoid TNT or feathers will fly!

_"Follow this path to get me to the pig!"_

Avoid the TNT.

_"Keep calm and help me find the bad pig. Otherwise I might get angry!"_

Get the bird to the pig and avoid the TNT.

_"It's time to get angry!"_

**Challenge:** This code has a lot of bugs. You'll need to remove some blocks and add others.
_"Keep calm and help me find the bad pig."_
_"Keep calm and help me find the bad pig."_
_"Now, help me sneak up on the pig any way you want to!"_
The bird needs your help! The pig is hiding, and the goal is to find it.
Sometimes there is more than one way to solve the same problem. Sometimes it's faster to go backwards than it is to go forwards!

This code isn't quite right!  

Fix the code to help Scrat get to the acorn.

Something is not quite right. 

Remove blocks to get Scrat to the acorn!
If Scrat turns too often, he might get dizzy! Help him reach the acorn with only four `turn` commands.

**Free Play:** This is Laurel the Adventurer! Move her around and get as much treasure as you can. Use the `collect` block to pick up the treasure!

Drag blocks into the workspace and try to figure out how to get treasure.  Get at least one item to pass this level.
Move Laurel to the treasure, then use <xml><block type="collector_collect"/></xml> to pick it up.

_"Sequence matters!"_ 

The blocks you need are already in the workspace, but not connected.  
Order these blocks to collect the treasure and solve the puzzle.

_"Sequence matters!"_

The blocks you need are already in the workspace, but not connected.  

Put these blocks in order to collect all of the treasure and solve the puzzle.

_"Help me collect each bit of treasure!"_

These blocks are in the wrong order. Can you fix them?

_"Help me collect all of the treasure!"_

These blocks are in the wrong order. Reorder them to collect all of the treasure.

**Challenge:** _"What is going on here?"_

Even if we put these in the right order, there will still be some missing.  
Use blocks from the toolbox to collect all of the treasure.
_"Keep up the good work! Help me collect all of the treasure."_
_"Let's get all of the treasure!"_
Help Laurel collect all of the treasure.

You're almost done!  

Collect as many pieces of treasure as you can to finish the stage!
There are 20 pieces of treasure in this cave. Collect at least **10** to finish the challenge!

_"Hi, I'm an artist. You can write code to make me draw almost anything."_

Play with the blocks in the toolbox to see what they do!

_"Let's make a cage for my pet monster!"_

Drag blocks onto the screen to have the artist draw over the grey lines in the picture.  
(Each line is 100 pixels long)

_"This spaceship needs a window!"_

Each side of the inner square is 100 pixels and all of the angles are 90 degrees.

_"Oh no!  Starla's pet alien just flew away! Let's help the spacewoman!"_

Finish Starla's rocket so she can chase her pet.  
(Each side of the triangle is 100 pixels long and has 120 degree outer angles.)

_"Maybe we should make a tag for each of our pets in case they get lost!"_

Finish this tag by drawing a rectangle around the outside.  
(The long sides are 200 pixels each and the short sides are each 100 pixels)

_"Now a tag for Belle!"_

Draw this square with 200 pixel sides.

**Challenge:** This tag is a special one!  

Can you figure out how to draw the outline?  
(The long side is 150 pixels and each of the short sides are 75 pixels.)

One more tag.  This is a triangle for Pi.  
(Each side is 150 pixels)
Draw rooms for each of the animals. There are many different ways to solve this puzzle, so have some fun! Each square has a side length of 100 pixels.

_"Help me paint the yellow lines on this road!"_

The three line segments have lengths of 150, 100, and 200 pixels!

[][0] _"Go get the scrap metal, BB-8!"_ 

Use five of the same blocks to get the scrap metal. Scrap metal glows like this: [][1]

[][0] _"Go BB-8!"_

To get all the scrap metal, try creating a loop that uses only one block inside of a `repeat` block.

[][0] _"Keep it up, BB-8."_

In this puzzle, two `repeat` loops will help you get BB-8 to all of the scrap metal with the fewest number of blocks!

[][0] _"Can you get it all?"_

Loops even work with more than one block inside!  Can you loop this sequence?

[][0] _"You can do it!"_

Can you try to get all the scrap metal using just one loop? Try programming it all out then finding the repeating code to put in a loop.

[][0] _"Keep it up, BB-8."_

**Challenge:** Combine ideas from the last few puzzles to complete this level.

[][0] _"Keep going!"_

Use what you have learned to pick up all of the scrap metal!

[][0]
 _"Go BB-8!"_

You are doing great! Keep it up!

[][0] _"Keep going, BB-8!"_

You are almost there! This time, choose any path you like!

_"Let's hunt for treasure!"_

Help the collector get at least **5** pieces of treasure.

### The artist is in the wrong spot!

Use the <xml><block type="jump_to_xy" id="callMe"><title name="XPOS">200</title><title name="YPOS">200</title></block></xml> block to get the artist to the center of the play area.  
Then draw a line 50 pixels long with the <xml><block type="draw_move_by_constant"><title name="DIR">moveForward</title><title name="VALUE">50</title></block></xml> block.

Now, put this code into  a `repeat` block and loop it **6** times.

-   Notice that we have added a 60 degree turn at the end of the looped code to get a full rotation.

_"Fantastic!"_ 

Let's add some style by changing the brush using the <xml><block type="draw_line_style_pattern"> <title name="VALUE">DEFAULT</title></block></xml> block before our loop starts.

**Free Play:** Let's build something bigger, one step at a time!  

Use the `jump to 200 over 200 down` to get the artist to the center of the play area, then use the `draw a sticker` block to make a bird appear.  

* * *

Press "Finish" when you are happy with what you've made.
Now, use a loop to spin your bird around 12 times with a 30 degree turn.

So much fun!  

Now, add a bat sticker right after the bird to make an image like the one below.

* * *

[expandable][0]

Edit your code so that you jump forward by 75 pixels between stamping the bird and the bat. In this puzzle, make sure you have `jump to 200 over 200 down` inside of your loop, so you stay in the center!

* * *

[expandable][0]

What happens when you replace one or both of the stickers with a different creature?

* * *

[expandable][0]

What happens when you `move forward` then `move backward` by 100, 200, or 400 pixels somewhere inside the loop?  

-   Try using the `set pattern` block before you start your loop to make a work of art!
    * * *
    [expandable][0]

Add a third sticker anywhere in the loop that you want! What does it look like now?

-   Change the pattern on your brush for more variety!

* * *

[expandable][0]

Try changing the `repeat` loop to run a different number of times.  How far do you have to turn to go around in a full circle?

-   Try changing how many times you spin
    -   Try a 60 degree turn for 6 times around
    -   Try a 20 degree turn for 18 times around

* * *

This image uses a pirate, a ninja, and a giraffe. They loop 18 times with a 20 degree turn.

[expandable][0]

Now make something on your own.  What happens when you make two separate circles of different stickers?

* * *

Need an idea? Try making a design like this one.

[expandable][0]

Loops can be used to repeat more than moves.  

Use loops to collect all four of the pumpkins.
Can you combine two different loops to move toward the pumpkins, then collect them all?
Collect all of the pumpkins.

Now there is corn growing, too!

Collect all of the corn and all of the pumpkins.
Collect all of the corn and all of the pumpkins.
Collect all of the corn and all of the pumpkins.
Collect all of the corn and all of the pumpkins.

**Challenge:** Collect all of the corn and all of the pumpkins.

You can complete this challenge any way you want, but it will either take a lot of work or a lot of thinking!
Collect all of the corn and all of the pumpkins.
Collect all of the corn and all of the pumpkins.
Collect all of the corn and all of the pumpkins.
Collect all of the lettuce. Avoid the trees and fields!

Attach the `flap a normal amount` block to the `when click` event, then press "Run".   

* * *

Click or tap on the play space to move Flappy to the target.

The `when run` event allows you to run code as soon as your game starts.  

Try adding a block that sets the level speed when the "Run" button is pressed. 

* * *

Play the game and flap to the target to continue.

Now we've added the ground. 

Attach the `end game` block to the `when hit the ground` event. 

* * *

Play the game and crash the bird into the ground to continue.

Flappy will fly right through obstacles unless you write code to make him crash. 

Attach a block to the `when hit an obstacle` event so that the game ends when Flappy crashes into the first set of pipes.

We've added a scoreboard to count points when Flappy passes obstacles.  

Add a block to the `when pass an obstacle` event that scores a point, then press "Run" to fly Flappy through the first set of pipes.

Click the down arrow inside of the `flap a normal amount` block to pick a different flapping power.  

See if you can still score a point after making Flappy flap either a smaller or larger amount each time you click.
Next, try changing the scene by attaching a block to the `when run` event.

You can set the background under any event, not just when the game starts. 

Try setting a **random** scene when other events happen...for example, when passing an obstacle.
To mix things up, instead of ending the game when Flappy hits an obstacle, try setting the score back to 0.

Create your own Flappy game! 

You can change the visuals and the rules...even the gravity! 
When you're done, click "Finish" to share with friends on their phones.

The `repeat forever` block allows you to run code over and over forever.  Use this block to move Chomp the Dino (actor 2) up and down by 400 pixels forever.

[][0]

Can you have Waddles (actor 1) say "Ouch!" and play a "hit" sound if he runs into Chomp? 

When you're done, play the game to make that happen.

[][0]

Use a new block to make Waddles automatically move back to the start when he runs into the Dinosaur and when he scores a point. This will make your game more challenging and fun!

Play the game and move Waddles with the arrows until you score 5 or more points. Waddles must be moved to the `middle left` position of the screen to complete this challenge.
Add a second `move forward` block to reach the sheep.
Wood is a very important resource. Many things are made from it. Walk to the tree and use the `destroy` block command to chop it down.
Sheep-shearing time! Use the `shear` command to gather wool from both sheep.
Every house starts with a wall. Build the first part of your house by putting the `place` and `move forward` commands inside the repeat loop.
Build the rest of your house from any material you'd like. The `repeat` command will come in handy.

Lava is hiding beneath some of these blocks, which you'll need to cover up before moving forward. An `if` command will come in handy here. Add a `move forward` command in the correct place to mine these blocks.
Now things are getting tricky. Mine 3 redstone, but don’t fall in the lava. Use an `if` command to place cobblestone over any lava you uncover.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_maze_programming1_0: Make sure all of the blocks have been fully snapped together, then click "Run" again.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_maze_programming2_a: To use a <xml><block type="maze_moveForward"/></xml> block, drag it out of the toolbox and snap it to the <xml><block type="when_run"/></xml> block.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_maze_programming2_b: Make sure all of the blocks have been fully snapped together, then click "Run" again.

[][0]

To delete a block from the middle of your code, drag all of the blocks to another part of the workspace.

Drag the block you want to delete back to the toolbox.

Finally, put your other blocks back where they belong.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_maze_programming4_a: Remember that when you turn, you are turning from the _bird's_ point of view.  If you turn right, the bird will point down.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_maze_programming4_b:
To follow the path:

-   move forward
-   turn one way
-   move forward
-   turn back the other way
-   move forward

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_maze_programming5_a: Try using the "Step" button to run your code line by line. Can you figure out what you need to do next?
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_maze_programming5_b: The bird will need to make one turn to complete this puzzle. Can you figure out which way?
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_maze_programming5_c: The solution will have two `move forward` blocks, a turn, and two more `move forward` blocks.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_maze_programming6_a: There are two ways to solve this puzzle!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_maze_programming6_b: Follow your finger from the bird to the pig, which steps did you take?
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_maze_programming6_c: Remember you have to turn first, since the bird starts facing a wall.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_maze_programming6_d: Feel stuck?  Look at this path!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_maze_programming7_a: Don't forget to use the "Step" button to go through block by block and look for errors.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_maze_programming7_b: If you are having trouble figuring this puzzle out, try writing the moves down on a piece of paper.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_maze_programming8_a: Remember you can use the "Step" button to look through your code line-by-line if you get stuck.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_maze_programming8_b: Don't be afraid to make a mistake! Try adding blocks and running the code to see what will happen, even if you don't think you've solved the puzzle yet.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_maze_programming_challenge1_a: There are many ways to get to the pig. Use your finger to find a path and then program it!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_maze_programming_challenge2_a: _"If you send me backwards, be extra careful that I turn the correct way!"_

<xml><block type="controls_repeat_dropdown"><title name="TIMES" config="3-10">???</title></block></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_artist_loopsPrePre1a_a:
The first block you will need is:

<xml>  <block type="jump_to_xy" id="callMe">
    <title name="XPOS">200</title>
    <title name="YPOS">200</title>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_artist_loopsPrePre1a_b:
To move forward 50 pixels, use this block:

<xml><block type="draw_move_by_constant">
    <title name="DIR">moveForward</title>
    <title name="VALUE">50</title>
  </block></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_artist_loopsPre1a_a: Remember to put the `turn` block inside of the loop.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_artist_loopsPre1a_b: Your `repeat` loop should have 3 blocks inside of it: `jump to 200 over 200 down`, `move forward by 50 pixels`, and `turn right by 60 degrees`.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_artist_loop1_a: You don't need to make any changes to the loop, just put one block above it.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_artist_loop1_b:
This is the block you will need to set a pattern:

<xml>
<block type="draw_line_style_pattern">
    <title name="VALUE">DEFAULT</title>
  </block>
</xml>

Choose any pattern you like!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_artist_loops1a_a:
This is the first block you will need:

<xml>
<block type="jump_to_xy">
    <title name="XPOS">200</title>
    <title name="YPOS">200</title>
  </block>
</xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_artist_loops1a_b:
Use this block to draw the sticker!

<xml>
<block type="sticker">
    <title name="VALUE">Bird</title>
  </block>
</xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_artist_loops2a_a: Inside your loop, you will want to jump to 200 over 200 down, then draw the bird sticker, then turn 30 degrees.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_artist_loops2a_b: Click on the number at the top of the `repeat` loop to change how many times it repeats.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_artist_loops3a_a: You will want to add just one block inside of your loop, after the bird sticker.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_artist_loops3a_b: Use the drop down menu on the `draw sticker` block to find the bat sticker.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_artist_loops4a_a:
Use this block to jump forward:

<xml>
<block type="jump_by_constant">
    <title name="DIR">jumpForward</title>
    <title name="VALUE">100</title>
  </block>
</xml>

Don't forget to change how far!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_artist_loops5a_a: Use the drop down menus on the `draw sticker` blocks to change their images.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_artist_loops5b_a:
Use this block to set the pattern of your lines:

    <title name="VALUE">DEFAULT</title>
  </block>
</xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_artist_loops5b_b: To make a design like the one above, you will want to move backward the same amount that you move forward.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_artist_loops6a_a: To make a design like the one above, jump forward less than 75 pixels between each sticker.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_artist_loops7a_a:
A circle has 360 degrees. Multiply the degrees in your turn times the number of times you repeat. Does it equal 360?
Check the suggested rotations to see that this works!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_harvester_loops4_c: If you want to simplify your code, you can actually put one loop inside of another! This is called a **nested loop**.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_harvester_loops_challenge1_a: This is too hard without loops!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_harvester_loops_challenge1_b: You can repeat `move forward` and `pick corn` as many times as you need, then `turn right` at each corner.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_harvester_loops_challenge1_c:
The best way to collect the corn in the middle uses a `repeat` block inside of another `repeat` block.

<xml><block type="controls_repeat">
        <title name="TIMES">2</title>
        <statement name="DO">
          <block type="controls_repeat">
            <title name="TIMES">4</title>
            <statement name="DO">
              <block type="maze_move">
                <title name="DIR">moveForward</title>
                <next>
                  <block type="harvester_corn"/>
                </next>
              </block>
            </statement>
            <next>
              <block type="maze_turn">
                <title name="DIR">turnRight</title>
              </block>
            </next>
          </block>
        </statement>
        </block></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_harvester_loops_challenge2_a: One way to solve this looks like a zig-zag. Another way looks like a spiral! There are lots of different solutions to a puzzle like this. Be persistent!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_harvester_loops_challenge2_b: You can repeat `move forward` and `pick lettuce` as many times as you need to, then turn at each corner.

This zig-zag pattern can be repeated twice to finish the puzzle with just 20 blocks!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_PlayLab_events4_a: You will need to attach an `actor __ say` block to the `when actor touches` event to solve this puzzle.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_PlayLab_events5_a: You will need to click the dropdown menu in the `actor say` block to find the text "What's new?"
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_PlayLab_events5_b: Click on Octavia when you run your program to check that it works!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_PlayLab_events6_a: Each green `when arrow` block should have one action below it.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_PlayLab_events6_b: Use the drop down menu on the `move actor 1` block to change which direction Waddles moves.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_PlayLab_events6_c: When you're done, you should be able to move Waddles around using the arrow keys on your computer!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_PlayLab_events7_a: Use both the `move actor 2 up 400 pixels` block and the `move actor 2 down 400 pixels` block inside the `repeat forever` loop to solve this puzzle.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_PlayLab_events7_b: The `repeat forever` loop does not need to be connected to any other event blocks; it will run on its own.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_PlayLab_events8_a: You will need to connect blocks to the `when actor touches` block to make this happen correctly.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_PlayLab_events8_b: The `actor say` and `play sound` blocks in the toolbox should help you out!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_PlayLab_events9_a: The `score point` block will help you to solve this puzzle.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_PlayLab_events9_b: Make sure that your new `when actor touches` block says actor **1** and actor **3**.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_PlayLab_events9_c: You can have more than one `when actor touches` event in your workspace at the same time, so you don't have to delete the first one!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_PlayLab_eventsA_a: Use the `set background` block and the `set actor to a ____ speed` block to solve this puzzle.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_PlayLab_eventsA_b: You will need to specifically drag a `when run` event block into the workspace to solve this puzzle.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.idea1:
_Need an idea?_

**Who's there?** Make characters appear with random images, so no one knows who's showing up next.

[][0]
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.idea2:
_Need an idea?_

**Going on an Adventure** - Change the background, then have the characters talk about where they are now.

[][0]
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.idea3:
_Need an idea?_

**Pinball** - Make one character move using the arrow keys (use `when up arrow`, `when down arrow` blocks), then play random sounds when it collides with other characters on the screen.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_PlayLab_events_challenge_a:
You can use this block to move actors to different places on the game space.

<xml> <block type="studio_setSpritePosition">
    <title name="SPRITE">0</title>
    <title name="VALUE">12</title>
  </block></xml>
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_PlayLab_events_challenge_b: Try using `set actor 1 to the middle left position` when it touches either of the other actors. This will reset the game so the player can keep trying!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_PlayLab_events_challenge_c:
You might also want to try changing the speed of the different actors to make the game easier or more challenging!

<xml>  <block type="studio_setSpriteSpeed">
    <title name="SPRITE">0</title>
    <title name="VALUE">Studio.SpriteSpeed.FAST</title>
  </block></xml>

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_1_a: The `move forward` block is at the top of the toolbox.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_1_b: Make sure both `move forward` blocks are snapped to the `when run` block.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_2_a: You need to `move forward` twice to stand in front of the tree.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_2_b: The `destroy block` command cuts down the tree in front of you.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_3_a: The `shear` block gets the sheep in front of you. Are you facing the sheep?
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_3_b: If you need to change the way you are facing, use a `turn` block.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_3_c: Don't be afraid to make a mistake! Run the code to see what happens, even if you haven't solved the puzzle yet.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_4_a: You can chop down trees in any order. What path takes the smallest number of blocks?
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_4_b: The `destroy block` command cuts down the tree in front of you.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_5_a: Use the `place` block first, and then the `move` block.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_5_b: Make sure both blocks are inside of the `repeat` loop to run the code more than once.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_5_c: Don't be afraid to make a mistake! Run the code to see what happens, even if you haven't solved the puzzle yet.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_6_a: Click the arrow on the `place` block to choose what you want to place.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_6_b: Don't be afraid to make a mistake! Run the code to see what happens, even if you haven't solved the puzzle yet.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_6_c: You can put more than one block inside of a `repeat` loop.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_7_a: Use the `plant crop` block to plant a crop in the space where you are standing.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_7_b: Both stripes of dark brown land by the water need to be filled with crops.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_7_c: You can put more than one block inside of a `repeat` loop.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_8_a: There are a few paths you can take. Which is the shortest?
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_8_b: Use `repeat` loops to simplify your code.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_8_c: Your goal is to get into the doorway of the house at the top of the screen.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_9_a: Are you facing the right way? The `destroy block` mines the block in front of you.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_9_b: The black specks in the wall are coal! Use `destroy block` on these to mine the coal.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_9_c: Use `place torch` to put a torch in the space where you are standing.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_10_a: The iron blocks are the speckled spaces behind the torch! How are you going to get over there?
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_10_b: When you are standing at the edge of the lava, use `place cobblestone ahead` to make a safe path. Then, you can walk over it!
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_10_c: Don't be afraid to make a mistake! Run the code to see what happens, even if you haven't solved the puzzle yet.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_11_a: All of the code is in place to check for lava and deal with it. All you need to do is add a block to move.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_11_b: Should your `move forward` command go inside of the `if` statement or after?

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_12_a: The spaces with red speckles are where you will find Redstone.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_12_b: Can you use a `repeat` loop to make your code shorter?
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_12_c: Use an `if` statement to check spaces for lava, then place cobblestones.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_13_a: Use `place rail` to lay rail on the square you are standing in.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.mc_13_b: Use `repeat` loops to make your code shorter.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.grade2_CaringForNewPet_0_1: After connecting all the blocks, press "Run" to start your program.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_maze_programming2_1: This is the toolbox. It’s where you’ll find extra blocks to complete your puzzles.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_maze_programming3_2: You can drag extra blocks to the toolbox to throw them away.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_maze_programming3_3: These blocks are stone and cannot be thrown away.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_maze_programming4_1: This is your block limit.  It tells you how many of these blocks you have left to use.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s: These blocks don't have numbers on them. You can use as many as you want!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_maze_programming7_1: This is your first challenge puzzle! These are meant to be hard and may take several tries.
https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_maze_programming7_2: These blocks are made of stone and can't be thrown away.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_maze_debugging5_1: These gray blocks are locked and cannot be deleted!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_collector_prog1_1: Do you see some new blocks in the toolbox?  Don't worry, we will show you how to use them in another lesson.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_collector_prog7_1: You can take more blocks from the toolbox if you need them!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_starWars_loops2: You only have one of these blocks available in this puzzle.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_artist_loopsPrePre1a_1: Start by using this block to get the artist to the center of the screen.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_harvester_loops1_callout1: The number four on the pumpkin tells you that there are four pumpkins available to pick.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_PlayLab_events8_callout1: Use this block for when Waddles and Chomp touch!

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.courseC_PlayLab_events_challenge1_1: This block lets you move actors to different parts of the game space.

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.craft_drag_block_callout: Drag a "move forward" block and snap it below the other block

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.craft_callout_preplaced: We've put some blocks here to get you started

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.craft_inside_repeat: Repeat actions by placing blocks in here

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.craft_callout_preplaced_house: This code will start building your house. Can you finish it?

https://studio.code.org/s/coursec-2018/s.craft_callout_moveforward: This code will check for lava, can you add a command to move forward?
